intro: Trigonospora sericea, commonly known as the silky trigonospora, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-green leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Trigonospora sericea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
